content.description: Students in a physics class designed an experiment to investigate the effect of blade width on flight time for paper helicopters. A histogram of the flight times, in seconds, and a scatterplot of flight time versus blade width, in centimeters (<math alttext="c m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>cm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>), are shown for <math alttext="25" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> helicopters.
content.question: Which of the following best describes the clusters and the gap in the histogram?

choices.label: The left cluster displays flight times for blade widths from <math alttext="1.5 centimeters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mtext>cm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="2.5 centimeters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mtext>cm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the right cluster displays flight times for the remaining blade widths.

The left cluster displays flight times for blade widths of <math alttext="1.5 centimeters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mtext>cm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the right cluster displays flight times for the remaining blade widths.
The left cluster displays minimum flight times for each of the blade widths, and the right cluster displays the remaining flight times.
The clusters are not related to the blade widths because flight time is measured in seconds and blade widths are measured in centimeters.
The clusters are not related to the blade widths because the relationship between blade width and flight time is not linear.

content.answer: The left cluster displays flight times for blade widths of <math alttext="1.5 centimeters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mtext>cm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the right cluster displays flight times for the remaining blade widths.

topic.text: 1.6: Describing the Distribution of a Quantitative Variable

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Describe data presented numerically or graphically.
